intro: Verbena variabilis, commonly known as the common verbena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and produces small, four-angled stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly rough texture. Verbena variabilis thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
